description: President Trump expressed his displeasure with Israel's strike on Hamas leaders in Doha, Qatar, which resulted in civilian casualties and strained relations. The attack, conducted without prior notification to the US, jeopardizes ceasefire efforts and drew condemnation from Qatar. While acknowledging the goal of eliminating Hamas, Trump criticized the unilateral action in a sovereign nation.

title: Deadly protests: Is Nepal returning to monarchy? What prophecy says
description: Nepal is witnessing a surge of protests. Initially sparked by Gen Z against social media bans, demonstrations now target government corruption, raising questions about Prime Minister Oli's successor. Simultaneously, pro-royalist movements are gaining momentum, demanding the monarchy's restoration amidst frustration over post-monarchy instability. However, a centuries-old prophecy and constitutional hurdles pose significant challenges to Gyanendra's return, despite growing calls.

Modi anticipates speaking with Trump soon, aiming for a brighter future for both nations as teams work to conclude negotiations swiftly.

description: Azmatullah Omarzai smashed a blistering 50 off just 20 balls to power Afghanistan to a commanding total in their Asia Cup opener against Hong Kong. Hong Kong’s sloppy fielding, marked by several dropped catches, only added to Afghanistan’s momentum in the closing stages.

description: The Minnesota Lynx are favored to win against the Indiana Fever on September 9, 2025, despite both teams facing injury challenges. While the Lynx will miss Napheesa Collier and DiJonai Carrington, their superior record and balanced team make them a formidable opponent.

Solar eclipse 2025: When is Surya Grahan; will it be visible in India?
description: September 2025 features a rare celestial double feature: a dramatic lunar eclipse on the 7th and a partial solar eclipse on the 21st. The solar eclipse, dubbed the "equinox eclipse," will be visible at sunrise in the Southern Hemisphere, particularly in New Zealand, eastern Australia, and parts of the South Pacific.

Ericsson job cuts in Canada: Around 100 employees impacted; staff notified
description: Swedish telecom giant Ericsson is cutting around 100 technical jobs in Canada, according to reports. The move, announced on September 8th with an effective date of October 31st, is part of a global streamlining effort. Ericsson aims to align its Canadian network management services with worldwide operations, utilizing common tools and processes.

title: Google tightens AI use: Coders face strict rules; external tools prohibited
description: Google is mandating its software engineers to exclusively use internal AI models for coding, driven by CEO Sundar Pichai's call for AI adoption to maintain competitiveness. Employees are expected to demonstrate AI proficiency, potentially influencing performance reviews and career advancement.

title: ‘Phillies Karen’ identified, fired after taking Bader HR ball from kid
description: During a Phillies vs. Marlins game, Harrison Bader's home run ball was caught by Drew Feltwell, who gifted it to his son Lincoln. A woman demanded the ball, sparking outrage online and earning her the moniker "Phillies Karen." Despite mistaken identity claims involving Leslie-Ann Kravitz and Cheryl Richardson-Wagner, the woman's true identity remains unconfirmed.

title: Ciara’s son with rapper Future now carries Russell Wilson’s last name
description: Ciara Wilson has legally added her husband Russell Wilson's last name to her eldest son, Future Zahir's, name, reflecting Russell's significant role as a stepfather. This decision, years in the making, symbolizes the couple's commitment to their blended family. Russell's philosophy of loving all children equally resonates with their united and supportive family dynamic.
